snippet: KELLY--Ellsworth. Pratt Institute is saddened by the loss of one of the most defining abstract painters of our time, Ellsworth Kelly, who studied at the institution in the 1940s. Minimal in form, bold in color, and widely influential, Kelly's work is featured in prominent museums, galleries, and private collections across the globe. As a true pioneer extending the boundaries of creativity, Kelly will be revered for his iconic style and artistic vision for generations to come. Pratt Institute Board of Trustees Chairman Bruce Gitlin, President Thomas F. Schutte 1/3
lead_paragraph: KELLY--Ellsworth. Pratt Institute is saddened by the loss of one of the most defining abstract painters of our time, Ellsworth Kelly, who studied at the institution in the 1940s. Minimal in form, bold in color, and widely influential, Kelly's work is featured in prominent museums, galleries, and private collections across the globe. As a true pioneer extending the boundaries of creativity, Kelly will be revered for his iconic style and artistic vision for generations to come. Pratt Institute Board of Trustees Chairman Bruce Gitlin, President Thomas F. Schutte 1/3
